intro: Geraniospermum revolutum, commonly known as the revolute geraniosperm, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae, which includes several genera of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Geraniospermum revolutum is often found in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
